intro: Sphaerocephalus latifolius, commonly known as the broadleaf sphaerocephalus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its spherical, clustered inflorescence and broad, flat leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as woodlands and streambanks. Its flowers are small and white, arranged in dense umbels, contributing to its ornamental value. The species is noted for its adaptability to various soil types and its ability to thrive in temperate climates.
